entry.title: David Cortés (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that David Cortés (pictured), a member of the Bolivian Chamber of Deputies, was dubbed the "Santa Claus of Potosí"?

entry.title: yoga nidra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that yoga nidra, a state of consciousness "in which Buddhas may access secret knowledge", is being studied for potential treatment of sleep problems?

entry.title: Nintendo Switch emulation (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kotaku revised an article about Nintendo Switch emulation after Nintendo complained that the previous version encouraged piracy?

entry.title: Anton Tohill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Collingwood coach Robert Harvey gave Anton Tohill his AFL debut in 2021, having played International Rules Series against Tohill's father in the 1990s?

entry.title: Icy Chain (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in her song "Icy Chain", Saweetie disses PETA, telling them she wears fur?

entry.title: Fairmont Beijing (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that University of Exeter lecturer Fu Jia and his coauthors said in 2017 that "uniquely for any hotel in China", Fairmont Beijing has three workers who have learning disabilities?

entry.title: Robert Micklewright (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Robert Micklewright created the cover art for Nobel Prize winner V. S. Naipaul's first two novels?

entry.title: Studio 54 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1979, the Studio 54 nightclub started serving fruit punch because its owners were arrested?
